isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON 2000 SERIES™ (LCT) TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - BACKUP LIGHT FUNCTION

svcproc.title: BACKUP LIGHT FUNCTION
svcproc.para: The backup light function is controlled by the NSBU.
With the key switch ON, power from ignition voltage from fuse F1 (A1 for 3800) is supplied through circuit 71, back up light switch connector (304), and terminal C of connector (3026).

When the transmission is in REVERSE the switch contacts will close applying voltage to terminal F, circuit 71A, back up light switch connector (304), circuit 71A and circuit 71B to the back-up lights.
